text.section:
Except as provided in this section for an action under § 14-404 of this subtitle or § 14-5A-17 of this title, any person aggrieved by a final decision of the Board in a contested case, as defined in the Administrative Procedure Act, may:
Appeal that decision to the Board of Review; and
Then take any further appeal allowed by the Administrative Procedure Act.

section.section: Any person aggrieved by a final decision of the Board under § 14-404 of this subtitle or § 14-5A-17 of this title may not appeal to the Secretary or Board of Review but may take a direct judicial appeal.
The appeal shall be made as provided for judicial review of final decisions in the Administrative Procedure Act.

text.section: An order of the Board may not be stayed pending review.
The Board may appeal from any decision that reverses or modifies its order.
